title: Conditional Logic - Making Decisions
description: Learn to make decisions in your code using if/else statements and comparison operators. This introduces logical thinking and decision-making patterns essential for kernel development where conditions determine code flow.

files.name: conditions.h
conditions.c
Makefile
files.content:
# Conditional logic module Makefile
obj-m += conditions.o

# Kernel build directory
KDIR := /lib/modules/$(shell uname -r)/build

# Default target
all:
	make -C $(KDIR) M=$(PWD) modules

clean:
	make -C $(KDIR) M=$(PWD) clean

install: all
	make -C $(KDIR) M=$(PWD) modules_install

help:
	make -C $(KDIR) M=$(PWD) help

.PHONY: all clean install help

testCases.name: Advanced Conditional Logic with TCC Header Validation

userspaceApps.name: conditional_tester

testCommands: echo 'Creating minimal kernel header stubs for TCC...'
echo 'Creating test file that includes student header...'
if [ $TCC_EXIT_CODE -ne 0 ]; then echo 'FAIL: Function declaration missing or commented in header'; echo 'TCC Error Details:'; cat /tmp/tcc_error.log; exit 1; fi
echo 'PASS: Function declaration found in header file'
echo 'Validating positive number logic (99 should be positive)'
dmesg | grep 'Number 99 is positive' && echo 'PASS: Positive number logic correct' || { echo 'FAIL: Positive number logic wrong'; exit 1; }
echo 'Validating negative number logic (-88 should be negative)'
dmesg | grep 'Number -88 is negative' && echo 'PASS: Negative number logic correct' || { echo 'FAIL: Negative number logic wrong'; exit 1; }
echo 'Validating zero logic (0 should be zero)'
dmesg | grep 'Number 0 is zero' && echo 'PASS: Zero logic correct' || { echo 'FAIL: Zero logic wrong'; exit 1; }
echo 'Checking that specific test values produced correct results'

if [ $TEST_99_POSITIVE -eq 1 ] && [ $TEST_88_NEGATIVE -eq 1 ] && [ $TEST_0_ZERO -ge 1 ]; then echo 'PASS: All conditional logic working correctly'; else echo 'FAIL: Conditional logic validation failed - Test 99: '$TEST_99_POSITIVE', Test -88: '$TEST_88_NEGATIVE', Test 0: '$TEST_0_ZERO; exit 1; fi

stdout: PASS: Function declaration found in header file
PASS: All conditional logic working correctly
